intro: Bigelowia parryi, commonly known as the Parry's bigelowia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, such as rocky soils and open plains. It produces small, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the spring and summer months. Bigelowia parryi is often found in disturbed areas and can serve as an indicator of ecological change in its habitat.
